DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Carcinoma Digital Rectal Examination T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Based on digital rectal examination, the extent of the primary prostate carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Carcinoma Digital Rectal Examination T Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease._An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease._An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.

Concepts.definition: One of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease.

An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.

Property.preferredDefinition: One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prostate Carcinoma Digital Rectal Examination T Category

Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas. ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than or Equal To Prostate Cancer cT1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways._Prostate cancer in which the tumor is identified by needle biopsy found in one or both sides, but not palpable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is identified by needle biopsy found in one or both sides, but not palpable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is palpable and confined within the prostate. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is palpable and confined within the prostate. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT3a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic extension (unilateral or bilateral). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT3a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic extension (unilateral or bilateral). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT3b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor invades seminal vesicle(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT3b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor invades seminal vesicle(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

Concepts.definition: One of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas. An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
